dnsRefreshRate.description: DNSRefreshRate specifies the rate at which DNS records should be refreshed. Defaults to 30 seconds.

lookupFamily.description:
LookupFamily determines how Envoy would resolve DNS for Routes where the backend is specified as a fully qualified domain name (FQDN). If set, this configuration overrides other defaults.

Possible enum values:
 - `"IPv4"` means the DNS resolver will first perform a lookup for addresses in the IPv4 family.
 - `"IPv4AndIPv6"` mean the DNS resolver will perform a lookup for both IPv4 and IPv6 families, and return all resolved addresses. When this is used, Happy Eyeballs will be enabled for upstream connections.
 - `"IPv4Preferred"` means the DNS resolver will first perform a lookup for addresses in the IPv4 family and fallback to a lookup for addresses in the IPv6 family.
 - `"IPv6"` means the DNS resolver will first perform a lookup for addresses in the IPv6 family.
 - `"IPv6Preferred"` means the DNS resolver will first perform a lookup for addresses in the IPv6 family and fallback to a lookup for addresses in the IPv4 family.

respectDnsTtl.description: RespectDNSTTL indicates whether the DNS Time-To-Live (TTL) should be respected. If the value is set to true, the DNS refresh rate will be set to the resource recordâ€™s TTL. Defaults to true.
